Based on the user's preference cues and the genre list provided, I would recommend the movie "We the Living". 

This movie is based on a novel of the same name by Ayn Rand. The movie follows three people who have to struggle for existence behind the Red banners and slogans.

The movie "We the Living" challenges the modern conscience and offers an answer that challenges the modern conscience.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend the movie "Inside Out" (2015).
The plot of "Inside Out" revolves around a young girl named Riley who has been experiencing anxiety attacks due to her parents' divorce.
In order to cope with her anxiety and to help her understand her emotions better, the movie portrays a journey inside Riley's head where she meets five different emotions - Joy, Fear, Sadness, Anger.

Throughout their journey, Joy and Fear become friends and team up against Sadness. Similarly, Anger and Joy team up against Fear, while Sadness and Anger team up against Joy and Fear.
In the end, Riley realizes that her anxiety attacks were just a way for her emotions to express themselves better.
"Inside Out" is a beautifully animated movie that not only tells an interesting story but also provides valuable insights into human emotions.
